item.title: [pi]ActionHandler help.[pi]

item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

justinkiller:

I know that is why I am asking for help. Im so confused because I have heavily modified my server, this is the one thing that doesn’t work. The one thing I can not get to work. I copied your code exactly into me actionhandler.java compiled, ran my server, logged on, click the altar and nothing happened. In my chat area it even said itemid 410. So I am utterly confused. I am not stupid, and I have some experience with java.

I hope you mean object, I’ll post a video of it working, I used the same code I gave you it work’s perfectly fine.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N3toVhruFYw

@zyle1992 wrote:

Put this as the first line in the case statement:

System.out.println(c.playerMagicBook);

If there’s no output, then 410 isn’t the right id.

item.title: [pi]ActionHandler help.[pi]
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

		case 410:
			if (this.c.playerMagicBook == 0) {
				this.c.playerMagicBook = 1;
				this.c.setSidebarInterface(6, 12855); // ancient
				this.c.sendMessage("An ancient wisdomin fills your mind.");
				this.c.getPA().resetAutocast();
			} else if (this.c.playerMagicBook == 1) {
				this.c.setSidebarInterface(6, 16640); // lunar
				this.c.playerMagicBook = 2;
				this.c.sendMessage("Your mind becomes stirred with thoughs of dreams.");
				this.c.autocastId = -1;
				this.c.getPA().resetAutocast();
			} else if (this.c.playerMagicBook == 2) {
				this.c.setSidebarInterface(6, 1151); // modern
				this.c.playerMagicBook = 0;
				this.c.sendMessage("You feel a drain on your memory.");
				this.c.autocastId = -1;
				this.c.getPA().resetAutocast();
			}
			break;

Also, are you putting this under firstClickObject?

Read full topic

item.title: [pi]ActionHandler help.[pi]
item.dc:creator: @justinkiller justinkiller
item.description:
@justinkiller wrote:

So I am pretty confused, Im trying to make it so when I click the altar for lunars it changes my magics. I want it like if i have modern magick, then it gives me ancients, if i have ancients it gives me lunars, and if i have lunars it gives me moderns. My code so far is this,

			case 410:
				if (c.playerMagicBook == 0){ 
				c.playerMagicBook = 1;
				c.setSidebarInterface(6, 12855); //ancient
				c.sendMessage("An ancient wisdomin fills your mind.");
				c.getPA().resetAutocast();
			} 
				else
				if (c.playerMagicBook == 1){
				c.setSidebarInterface(6, 16640); //lunar
				c.playerMagicBook = 2;
				c.sendMessage("Your mind becomes stirred with thoughs of dreams.");
				c.autocastId = -1;
				c.getPA().resetAutocast();
			}
				else
				if (c.playerMagicBook == 2){
				c.setSidebarInterface(6, 1151); //modern
				c.playerMagicBook = 0;
				c.sendMessage("You feel a drain on your memory.");
				c.autocastId = -1;
				c.getPA().resetAutocast();
}

It compiles and everything, so I think it is right. My character has lunars right now, i click it and it does nothing, so i guess its wrong. Any help? Im pretty sure it is something very obvious that I will feel stupid about when someone points it out.

Read full topic
